description: Contract description is null The company wants us to operate an analysis of the current workload of Canadian Coast Guard incumbents under two specific directives. Finally, recommend integration of National Joint Council travel directive into Coast Guard Directives
full_summary:
================================

### Canadian Coast Guard National Home Port Analysis

#### Solicitation Details

* **Solicitation Reference:** cb-9335-9849813
* **Amendment Number:** 1
* **Solicitation Number:** 30004851
* **Publication Date:** 2023-09-21
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-10-06T14:00:00
* **Amendment Date:** 2023-10-06
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-10-16
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 2024-04-12

#### Procurement Information

* **Procurement Category:** SRV
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements:** This solicitation is open to suppliers meeting the requirements of the following trade agreements:
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
	+ Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
	+ World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
	+ Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

#### Contract Requirements

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires a senior Business Analyst to perform an analysis of the current workload associated with the National Joint Council's (NJC) travel directive and to compare it with other operational centers for consistency in application and methodology. The contractor will also provide options that include the financial impact and pros and cons of the national home port concept, where employees would be pooled from one or several locations across Canada.

The contract period will be from the date of contract award to April 12, 2024, inclusive. The contract will include an irrevocable option to extend the contract term by up to one additional year under the same conditions.

#### Eligibility Requirements

This solicitation is open only to those Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders under E60ZT-18TSPS who qualified under Tier 1 for the following category:
2.1 Business
